update.description:
Initial check-in of the SubT scoring system for public visibility of the sample code and the drop-in ROS interfaces. The main information is in the [README.md](http://README.md) in commandpost\_relay, where I’ve explained the ROS interface to the ICD.

This should successfully build and and run on an Ubuntu 16.04 install with ROS Kinetic. I was a bit unsure if we’d shifted over into 18.04/Melodic quite yet.

This is not the full scoring server, though I think eventually we need to have \(a version of\) the scoring server in here simply so that the virtual testbed can be self-contained.
update.title: SubT Scoring System
update.reason: I believe the plan is to create a stand-alone scoring server that the virtual testbed will use instead of direct integration.

content.raw: Is it necessary to directly include all of the `external` dependencies, or can use system libraries? Removal of the `externals` directory would greatly reduce the footprint of this pull request.
content.html: Is it necessary to directly include all of the external dependencies, or can use system libraries? Removal of the externals directory would greatly reduce the footprint of this pull request.

update.description:
Initial check-in of the SubT scoring system for public visibility of the sample code and the drop-in ROS interfaces. The main information is in the [README.md](http://README.md) in commandpost\_relay, where I’ve explained the ROS interface to the ICD.

This should successfully build and and run on an Ubuntu 16.04 install with ROS Kinetic. I was a bit unsure if we’d shifted over into 18.04/Melodic quite yet.

This is not the full scoring server, though I think eventually we need to have \(a version of\) the scoring server in here simply so that the virtual testbed can be self-contained.
